items.name: typealias UInt.IntegerLiteralType
items.desc: A type that represents an integer literal.

items.name: typealias UInt.Magnitude
items.desc: A type that can represent the absolute value of any possible value of this type.

items.name: typealias UInt.Stride
items.desc: A type that represents the distance between two values.

items.name: init()
items.desc: Creates a new value equal to zero.

items.name: init(Double)
items.desc: Creates an integer from the given floating-point value, rounding toward zero.

items.name: init(Float80)
items.desc: Creates an integer from the given floating-point value, rounding toward zero.

items.name: init(Float)
items.desc: Creates an integer from the given floating-point value, rounding toward zero.

items.name: init<T>(T)
items.desc: Creates a new instance from the given integer.

items.name: init<T>(T)
items.desc: Creates an integer from the given floating-point value, rounding toward zero. Any fractional part of the value passed as source is removed.

items.name: init?(String)
items.desc: Creates a new integer value from the given string.

items.name: init(Float16)
items.desc: Creates an integer from the given floating-point value, rounding toward zero.

items.name: init?<S>(S, radix: Int)
items.desc: Creates a new integer value from the given string and radix.

items.name: init(bigEndian: UInt)
items.desc: Creates an integer from its big-endian representation, changing the byte order if necessary.

items.name: init(bitPattern: Int)
items.desc: Creates a new instance with the same memory representation as the given value.

items.name: init(bitPattern: OpaquePointer?)
items.desc: Creates a new value with the bit pattern of the given pointer.

items.name: init(bitPattern: ObjectIdentifier)
items.desc: Creates an integer that captures the full value of the given object identifier.

items.name:
init

(bitPattern: P?)
items.desc: Creates a new value with the bit pattern of the given pointer.

items.name: init<Other>(clamping: Other)
items.desc: Creates a new instance with the representable value that’s closest to the given integer.

items.name: init?(exactly: Float)
items.desc: Creates an integer from the given floating-point value, if it can be represented exactly.

items.name: init?(exactly: Double)
items.desc: Creates an integer from the given floating-point value, if it can be represented exactly.

items.name: init?(exactly: Float80)
items.desc: Creates an integer from the given floating-point value, if it can be represented exactly.

items.name: init?<T>(exactly: T)
items.desc: Creates an integer from the given floating-point value, if it can be represented exactly.

items.name: init?<T>(exactly: T)
items.desc: Creates a new instance from the given integer, if it can be represented exactly.

items.name: init?(exactly: Float16)
items.desc: Creates an integer from the given floating-point value, if it can be represented exactly.

items.name: init(from: Decoder)
items.desc: Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder.

items.name: init(integerLiteral: UInt)
items.desc: Creates an instance initialized to the specified integer value.

items.name: init(littleEndian: UInt)
items.desc: Creates an integer from its little-endian representation, changing the byte order if necessary.

items.name: init<T>(truncatingIfNeeded: T)
items.desc: Creates a new instance from the bit pattern of the given instance by truncating or sign-extending if needed to fit this type.

items.name: var bigEndian: UInt
items.desc: The big-endian representation of this integer.

items.name: var bitWidth: Int
items.desc: The number of bits in the binary representation of this value.

items.name: var byteSwapped: UInt
items.desc: A representation of this integer with the byte order swapped.

items.name: var customMirror: Mirror
items.desc: A mirror that reflects the UInt instance.

items.name: var description: String
items.desc: A textual representation of this value.

items.name: var hashValue: Int
items.desc: The hash value.

items.name: var leadingZeroBitCount: Int
items.desc: The number of leading zeros in this value’s binary representation.

items.name: var littleEndian: UInt
items.desc: The little-endian representation of this integer.

items.name: var magnitude: UInt
items.desc: The magnitude of this value.

items.name: var nonzeroBitCount: Int
items.desc: The number of bits equal to 1 in this value’s binary representation.

items.name: var trailingZeroBitCount: Int
items.desc: The number of trailing zeros in this value’s binary representation.

items.name: var words: UInt.Words
items.desc: A collection containing the words of this value’s binary representation, in order from the least significant to most significant.

items.name: static var bitWidth: Int
items.desc: The number of bits used for the underlying binary representation of values of this type.

items.name: static var isSigned: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether this type is a signed integer type.

items.name: static var max: UInt
items.desc: The maximum representable integer in this type.

items.name: static var min: UInt
items.desc: The minimum representable integer in this type.

items.name: static var zero: UInt
items.desc: The zero value.

items.name: func addingReportingOverflow(UInt) -> (partialValue: UInt, overflow: Bool)
items.desc: Returns the sum of this value and the given value, along with a Boolean value indicating whether overflow occurred in the operation.

items.name: func advanced(by: Int) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns a value that is offset the specified distance from this value.

items.name: func distance(to: UInt) -> Int
items.desc: Returns the distance from this value to the given value, expressed as a stride.

items.name: func dividedReportingOverflow(by: UInt) -> (partialValue: UInt, overflow: Bool)
items.desc: Returns the quotient obtained by dividing this value by the given value, along with a Boolean value indicating whether overflow occurred in the operation.

items.name: func dividingFullWidth((high: UInt, low: UInt.Magnitude)) -> (quotient: UInt, remainder: UInt)
items.desc: Returns a tuple containing the quotient and remainder of dividing the given value by this value.

items.name: func encode(to: Encoder)
items.desc: Encodes this value into the given encoder.

items.name: func hash(into: inout Hasher)
items.desc: Hashes the essential components of this value by feeding them into the given hasher.

items.name: func isMultiple(of: UInt) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns true if this value is a multiple of the given value, and false otherwise.

items.name: func multipliedFullWidth(by: UInt) -> (high: UInt, low: UInt.Magnitude)
items.desc: Returns a tuple containing the high and low parts of the result of multiplying this value by the given value.

items.name: func multipliedReportingOverflow(by: UInt) -> (partialValue: UInt, overflow: Bool)
items.desc: Returns the product of this value and the given value, along with a Boolean value indicating whether overflow occurred in the operation.

items.name: func quotientAndRemainder(dividingBy: UInt) -> (quotient: UInt, remainder: UInt)
items.desc: Returns the quotient and remainder of this value divided by the given value.

items.name: func remainderReportingOverflow(dividingBy: UInt) -> (partialValue: UInt, overflow: Bool)
items.desc: Returns the remainder after dividing this value by the given value, along with a Boolean value indicating whether overflow occurred during division.

items.name: func signum() -> UInt
items.desc: Returns -1 if this value is negative and 1 if it’s positive; otherwise, 0.

items.name: func subtractingReportingOverflow(UInt) -> (partialValue: UInt, overflow: Bool)
items.desc: Returns the difference obtained by subtracting the given value from this value, along with a Boolean value indicating whether overflow occurred in the operation.

items.name: static func random(in: ClosedRange<UInt>) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns a random value within the specified range.

items.name: static func random(in: Range<UInt>) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns a random value within the specified range.

items.name: static func random<T>(in: ClosedRange<UInt>, using: inout T) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns a random value within the specified range, using the given generator as a source for randomness.

items.name: static func random<T>(in: Range<UInt>, using: inout T) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns a random value within the specified range, using the given generator as a source for randomness.

items.name: static func != <Other>(UInt, Other) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the two given values are not equal.

items.name: static func != (UInt, UInt) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are not equal.

items.name: static func % (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the remainder of dividing the first value by the second.

items.name: static func %= (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Divides the first value by the second and stores the remainder in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func & (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the result of performing a bitwise AND operation on the two given values.

items.name: static func &* (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the product of the two given values, wrapping the result in case of any overflow.

items.name: static func &*= (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Multiplies two values and stores the result in the left-hand-side variable, wrapping any overflow.

items.name: static func &+ (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the sum of the two given values, wrapping the result in case of any overflow.

items.name: static func &+= (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Adds two values and stores the result in the left-hand-side variable, wrapping any overflow.

items.name: static func &- (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the difference of the two given values, wrapping the result in case of any overflow.

items.name: static func &-= (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Subtracts the second value from the first and stores the difference in the left-hand-side variable, wrapping any overflow.

items.name: static func &<< <Other>(UInt, Other) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the left, masking the shift amount to the type’s bit width.

items.name: static func &<< (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the left, masking the shift amount to the type’s bit width.

items.name: static func &<<= (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the left, masking the shift amount to the type’s bit width, and stores the result in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func &<<= <Other>(inout UInt, Other)
items.desc: Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the left, masking the shift amount to the type’s bit width, and stores the result in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func &= (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Stores the result of performing a bitwise AND operation on the two given values in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func &>> <Other>(UInt, Other) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the right, masking the shift amount to the type’s bit width.

items.name: static func &>> (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the right, masking the shift amount to the type’s bit width.

items.name: static func &>>= <Other>(inout UInt, Other)
items.desc: Calculates the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the right, masking the shift amount to the type’s bit width, and stores the result in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func &>>= (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Calculates the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the right, masking the shift amount to the type’s bit width, and stores the result in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func * (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Multiplies two values and produces their product.

items.name: static func *= (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Multiplies two values and stores the result in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func + (UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the given number unchanged.

items.name: static func + (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Adds two values and produces their sum.

items.name: static func += (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Adds two values and stores the result in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func - (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Subtracts one value from another and produces their difference.

items.name: static func -= (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Subtracts the second value from the first and stores the difference in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func ... (UInt) -> PartialRangeFrom<UInt>
items.desc: Returns a partial range extending upward from a lower bound.

items.name: static func ... (UInt) -> PartialRangeThrough<UInt>
items.desc: Returns a partial range up to, and including, its upper bound.

items.name: static func ... (UInt, UInt) -> ClosedRange<UInt>
items.desc: Returns a closed range that contains both of its bounds.

items.name: static func ..< (UInt) -> PartialRangeUpTo<UInt>
items.desc: Returns a partial range up to, but not including, its upper bound.

items.name: static func ..< (UInt, UInt) -> Range<UInt>
items.desc: Returns a half-open range that contains its lower bound but not its upper bound.

items.name: static func / (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the quotient of dividing the first value by the second.

items.name: static func /= (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Divides the first value by the second and stores the quotient in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func < <Other>(UInt, Other) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than that of the second argument.

items.name: static func < (UInt, UInt) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than that of the second argument.

items.name: static func << <Other>(UInt, Other) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the left.

items.name: static func << <RHS>(UInt, RHS) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the left.

items.name: static func <<= <Other>(inout UInt, Other)
items.desc: Stores the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the left in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func <= <Other>(UInt, Other) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than or equal to that of the second argument.

items.name: static func <= (UInt, UInt) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than or equal to that of the second argument.

items.name: static func == <Other>(UInt, Other) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the two given values are equal.

items.name: static func == (UInt, UInt) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are equal.

items.name: static func > <Other>(UInt, Other) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than that of the second argument.

items.name: static func > (UInt, UInt) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than that of the second argument.

items.name: static func >= <Other>(UInt, Other) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than or equal to that of the second argument.

items.name: static func >= (UInt, UInt) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than or equal to that of the second argument.

items.name: static func >> <Other>(UInt, Other) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the right.

items.name: static func >> <RHS>(UInt, RHS) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the right.

items.name: static func >>= <Other>(inout UInt, Other)
items.desc: Stores the result of shifting a value’s binary representation the specified number of digits to the right in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func ^ (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the result of performing a bitwise XOR operation on the two given values.

items.name: static func ^= (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Stores the result of performing a bitwise XOR operation on the two given values in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func | (UInt, UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the result of performing a bitwise OR operation on the two given values.

items.name: static func |= (inout UInt, UInt)
items.desc: Stores the result of performing a bitwise OR operation on the two given values in the left-hand-side variable.

items.name: static func ~ (UInt) -> UInt
items.desc: Returns the inverse of the bits set in the argument.

items.name: struct UInt.SIMD16Storage
items.desc: Storage for a vector of 16 integers.

items.name: struct UInt.SIMD2Storage
items.desc: Storage for a vector of two integers.

items.name: struct UInt.SIMD32Storage
items.desc: Storage for a vector of 32 integers.

items.name: struct UInt.SIMD4Storage
items.desc: Storage for a vector of four integers.

items.name: struct UInt.SIMD64Storage
items.desc: Storage for a vector of 64 integers.

items.name: struct UInt.SIMD8Storage
items.desc: Storage for a vector of eight integers.

items.name: struct UInt.Words
items.desc: A type that represents the words of this integer.
